name: Hello! I am Pernelle,
body:
## About Me
I am currently a first PhD student integrated the Secure Cloud Networking (SCN) team in Nokia Bell Labs (France), the CIDRE team from Centrale Supélec Rennes and the MYRIADS team from Inria. 

## Research interests
I focus mainly on Cloud Security, especially on the elaboration of an adequate policy response, guided by dynamic risks management concepts. To tackle this issue, SDN technologies are also of interest to me.

## Publications 
###2015:
*    MENSAH Pernelle, BLANC Gregory, OKADA Kazuya, MIYAMOTO Daisuke, KADOBAYASHI Youki 
[AJNA: anti-phishing JS-based visual analysis, to mitigate users' excessive trust in SSL/TLS.](https://github.com/pernelleMensah/pernelleMensah.github.io/publications/mensah_badgers15.pdf) 
BADGERS 2015 : 4th International Workshop on Building Analysis Datasets and Gathering Experience Returns for Security, 05-05 november 2015, Kyoto, Japan, 2016 (document in press)


## Work Experience

*    _**April-September 2015: Internship at Nara Institute of Science and Technology (NAIST), Japan**_
Worked on the NECOMA project: development of interfaces to provide broad access to collected datasets to all researchers on the project.
[Research work](https://github.com/pernelleMensah/pernelleMensah.github.io/publications/mensah_badgers15.pdf) performed on the detection of HTTPS phishing websites guided by computer visual analysis.

*    _**August-September 2014: Internship at Sonepar, France**_
Supervised the deployment touchpads to nomad commercials: configuration verification, hotline service, development of a tool allowing to merge, fusion and add a summary to PDF files.

*    _**June-July 2013: Internship at Télécom SudParis, France**_
Accompanied students taking part in the entrance examination at Télécom SudParis, supervised a team of 5, assisted candidates by providing orientation and insights into the campus life

## Academic Background

*    _**Since September 2015**_: PhD student at Centrale Supelec Rennes working on Adaption of Security Policies guided by Risk Evaluation in Modern Communication Infrastructures
*    _**2012-2015**_: Engineer student in Technologies of Information and Communication with a Specialty in System and Networks Security
*    _**2010-2012**_: "Classes Préparatoires PTSI-PT", formation to prepare national exams to enter top-level Engineering Schools (Grandes Ecoles d'Ingénieurs) in France, with a focus on Physics, Technology and Engineering

##Extra Curricular Activities

*    _**2014**_: Finalist of the contest "IBM Master the Mainframe - France"
*    _**2012-2014**_: Member of the Informatic association MiNET at Télécom Sudparis
